AssayDataset.description: An assay dataset is a collection of data generated from a specific  experimental assay, providing details about the description of  the dataset, the technology or methodology used, and the  associated cell summaries that outline the analyzed cell types a nd their attributes.

CellSummary.description: A cell summary is a detailed overview of cell-related data, including  the annotation method used, summary rows with cell types and their  counts, the modality (e.g., scRNA-seq), aggregated summaries of  findings, and contextual information such as the donor tissue's sex.

aggregated_summaries.description: Collection of summaries derived by aggregating data across various  samples or cells.
aggregated_summaries.title: aggregated summary

annotation_method.description: Method used to annotate cells, detailing how each cell was identified or  labeled in the dataset.
annotation_method.title: annotation method

donor_sex.description: Biological sex of the donor from which the tissue samples were derived.
donor_sex.title: donor biological sex

CellSummaryRow.description: A cell summary row is a single entry in a cell summary table that  provides information about a specific cell type, including its name,  count, and any related attributes such as tissue, modality, or donor  characteristics.

TissueBlock.description: A tissue block is a defined piece of tissue extracted from a  specific location for research or analysis, with detailed  information about its extraction site, tissue sections,  associated datasets, section counts and sizes, and collision  summaries related to spatial overlaps.

collision_summaries.description: Summaries of collision data indicating spatial collisions with other organs.
collision_summaries.title: collision summary
